io.spine.server.transport

Class GrpcContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.transport.GrpcContainer

  • public class GrpcContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapping container for gRPC server.

    Maintains and deploys several of gRPC services within a single server.

    Uses ServerServiceDefinitions of each service.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the service.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to bind

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Returns true if the server is shut down or was not started at all, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        GrpcContainer.shutdown()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Initiates an orderly shutdown in which existing calls continue but new calls are rejected.

      • shutdownNowAndWait

        public void shutdownNowAndWait()
        Initiates a forceful shutdown in which preexisting and new calls are rejected.

        The method returns when the service becomes terminated. The most common usage scenario for this method is clean-up in unit tests (e.g. @AfterEach in JUnit5) that involve gRPC communications.

      • awaitTermination

        public void awaitTermination()
        Waits for the service to become terminated.

      • isScheduledForDeployment

        public boolean isScheduledForDeployment(io.grpc.BindableService service)
        Check if the given gRPC service is scheduled for the deployment in this container.

        Note that the given gRPC service will become available to the clients, once the gRPC container is started.

        To find out whether the service is already available for calls, use GrpcContainer.isLive(BindableService) method.

        Parameters:
        service - the gRPC service to check
        Returns:
        true, if the given gRPC service for deployment and false otherwise

      • isLive

        public boolean isLive(io.grpc.BindableService service)
        Check if the given gRPC service has actually been deployed and is available for interaction within this container.

        Returns true if and only if

        a. the service has been previously scheduled for the deployment,

        b. the container has been started.

        Parameters:
        service - the gRPC service
        Returns:
        true, if the service is available for interaction within this container and false otherwise

      • addShutdownHook

        public void addShutdownHook()
        Makes the JVM shut down the service when it is shutting down itself.

        Call this method when running the service in a separate JVM.
